p: Despite the wider use of folk medicine in developing nations, there are limited scientific evidences regarding safety profiles [ 23]. In Ethiopia, various medicinal plants such as Achyranthes aspera [ [33], [34], [35]], Satureja punctata [ 33, 34], Rumex abyssinicus, Chenopodium murale and Aloe pulcherrima [ 34] have been claimed to possess antiurolithiatic effects. To date, there is insufficiency of scientific evidence reported on the toxicity of these plants. Therefore, the objective of the present study was to evaluate acute and/or sub acute toxicity profiles of the aforementioned medicinal plants in albino Wistar female rats.
